Hey, {playername}. We tell you what.. ^Lads here grumbling! Want more fun, less marching around.
Fall back in line, maggot! We are at war and I'm your commander.
As you wish, commander. As you wish...
Hey, commander. We tell you what... Lads here are not happy, not happy at all. ^Not enough manflesh, not enough fun. ^Lads here talk you not good enough, commander!
What? Mutiny while at war? ^This is punishable by death, maggot!
We tell you what... ^Lads here think I be better commander for them when I KILL YOU!
Problem?
U mad?
Whoa! A talking troll?!
I own a horse.
Troll me, troll.
I own a horse.
Challenge accepted!^^{s4}
I bow to your wisdom, Master Baiter of Trolls!
TROLLOLOLOLOLOLOLOLOLOL!
Hello again, {playername}!
Hello again, {playername}!
Hello, {sir/madam}! My name is Meriadoc Brandybuck but you can call me Merry!
Hello, {sir/madam}! My name is Peregrin Took but you can call me Pippin!
I don't have time now.
Say. I think I never seen one of your kind.
Say. I think I've met another one like you, in Edoras.
Say. I think I've met another one like you, in Minas Tirith.
I know. I came from afar! I'm a Hobbit, {sir/madam}, from the Shire.

Oh, that must have been my dear cousin! Peregrin Took, or Pippin, how they call him. We are Hobbits, {sir/madam}, and we come from the Shire, both of us! Good old Pippin, I wonder how he is doing in Minas Tirith.

Oh, that must have been my dear cousin! Meriadoc Brandybuck, or Merry, how they call him. We are Hobbits, {sir/madam}, and we come from the Shire, both of us! Good old Merry, I wonder how he is doing back in Edoras.
Well, goodbye now.
Welcome back, {playername}!
Welcome back, {playername}!
Hello, messer Merry.
Hello, messer Pippin.

(You find that you are looking at a most extraordinary creature. He is very tall and stiff-limbed with bark-like skin and leafy hair. Moss is also covering parts of his body. But at the moment you are noting little but the eyes. The deep eyes are surveying you, slow and solemn but very sharp and penetrating. You think they are brown, shot with green light, as if there is an enormous well behind them, filled up with ages of memory and long, slow, steady thinking. But on the surface his eyes are sparkling with the present... like the sun shimmering on the outer leaves of a vast tree, or the ripples of a very deep lake.)

(You are about to say something but a strange stifling feeling falls upon you, as if the air is too thin or too scanty for breathing... with an almost desperate inhale of air you manage to shake loose the feeling and the huge tree-like creature drops the intensity of his gaze a little bit. The creature continues to look at you and you notice the other huge tree creatures are watching you too, as if expecting you to speak...)
Pardon my intrusion... I'm but a weary traveler seeking refuge from recent events... my name is {playername}. Might I ask who you are?

(The stiff-limbed tree giant slowly opens his mouth which is concealed behind small branches, leaves and moss. With a very deep, slow and booming voice he very slowly expounds in a most commanding way:)^  'Hrooom... Hmmm... *I* am not going to tell you my name... not yet at any rate. For one thing it would take a long while. My name is growing all the time and I've lived a very long, long time; so my name is like a story. Real names tell you the story of things they belong to in my language, in the Old Entish as you might say. It is a lovely language, but it takes a very long time saying anything in it, because we do not say anything in it, unless it is worth taking a long time to say, and to listen to.'
Oh, you are an Ent! Legends speak of you and I am honored to be in your presence. I do not wish to impose and will leave if you so wish.

(The stiff-limped giant and his fellow Ents stand still for many minutes in silence while a breeze passes through their leafy hairs and beards. They look at each other for another prolonged moment until an unusually hasty Ent who is resembling a rowan tree seems to want to speak. However, he stays silent until the giant stiff-limped Ent continues:)
ERROR

{reg2?As I said before...:Hroom... We appreciate the courteous manners that you display. It is {reg1?unusual from your race:nice to speak with elves again}.} Times are not good, ever since the Entwives disappeared - and now there are many evil creatures released by the Dark Lord himself who are trying to destroy our homes. We seek someone who is fast but not hasty. Someone who can help us while we discuss our next moves.^Many bands of orcs have raided the woods and burned down our trees with fire arrows - if you were to defeat the orcs and make sure that they do not threaten the woods we would be grateful and consider you a true friend. Do this and we will talk again.
Orcs are vile creatures indeed. I will make sure they do not harm the forest again.
Sorry. I don't have time for this right now.

(The Ent leader slowly opens his concealed mouth and the other Ents look at you and also slowly begin to utter a long deep sound that makes the ground shake a little - you realize that they are laughing in an Entish way. A relatively young Rowan tree looking Ent stomps his seven-toed large feet in the ground and the shake almost makes you fall.)^'Easy there, Quickbeam, we don't want to hurt our young warrior friend. Hrrrm... I am Treebeard, the oldest of the Ents, and we are all grateful for your services... Hrrrm... Let me give you a gift of Ent Water to celebrate your success.'
(The stiff-limped giant and his fellow Ents stand still in silence while a breeze passes through their leafy hairs and beards.)
ERROR
Hrooom... What would you like to know, young friend?
Tell me more about you.
Tell me about the Entwives.
Tell me about the Ents.
Never mind, goodbye.
(The Ent leader looks distant and solemn. After a while he slowly says:)^'Don't be hasty... we can talk more about this when the woods are safe from the orcs.'

Hrooom... I am the oldest of my kind hmmm... I am known as Treebeard by a few mortals and the Elves call me Fangorn. Hummm... I, Skinbark and Leaflock are the only Ents who have walked the forests before the Darkness. I am no longer very bendable as I used to be... young Quickbeam can bend and sway, like a slender tree in the wind... Hummm... If the Entwives were here...
(The Ent leader suddenly gets an expression of sadness and his voice is unusually deep.)^'Hummm... This is a sad tale... when the woods are free from the orcs we can discuss this.'

Ahummm... the beautiful Entwives... they like to plant and grow... we should have listened more to them... Hrooom... then they left to the Brown Lands to plant gardens and they taught mortals about making the lands fertile... we used to visit them... until... Sauron attacked... the Entwives are now lost... Hummm... Fimbrethil... her hue of ripe grain... we have looked for them... but not found them... yet...

Hrooom... We are shepherds of the Trees and we protect them from perils. We are older than any of the mortal races but not as old as the Elves who cured us from dumbness. Things have changed over the ages. In the beginning we were more hasty and flexible. Over time many of us have been lost. Some of us are still true Ents, and lively enough in our fashion, but many are growing sleepy, going tree-ish, as you might say. Most of the trees are just trees, of course; but many are half awake. Some are quite wide awake, and a few are, well, ah, well getting Entish. That is going on all the time. When that happens to a tree, you find that some have bad hearts. Still, we do what we can. We keep off strangers and the foolhardy; and we train and we teach, we walk and we weed.
Mmmmm?
Mmhhrmmm?
Mmmrhrrhmm?
Warning: This line should never be displayed.
Bow to the power of the {s4} and serve me!
We will obey, Master.
^^GROWL!^^
Yes, {playername}? What can I do for you?
Anything else?
I want to review the castle garrison.
Of course. Here are our lists, let me know of any changes you require...
Let me see your equipment.
Very well, it's all here...
I want you to abandon the castle and join my party.
I've grown quite fond of the place... But if it is your wish, {playername}, I'll come with you.
And where would we sleep? You're dragging a whole army with you, {playername}, there's no more room for all of us.
[Leave]
{playername}, when do you think we can reach our destination?
We still have a long way ahead of us.
Very soon. We're almost there.
We are ready to go on our scouting mission. Should we go now?
Yes, you've got your orders. Goodbye.
Wait a minute, not just yet.
Anything else?
Yes, {s5}?
Let me see your equipment.
I'm sorry, my equipment is my own.
Very well, it's all here...
What can you tell me about your skills?
All right, let me tell you...
We need to separate for a while.
Oh really? Well, I'm not just going to wait around here. I'm going to go back to {s4}. Is that what you want?
That's right. We need to part ways.
No, I'd rather have you at my side.
Well. I'll be off, then. Look me up if you need me.
I'd like to ask you something.
Never mind.
Very well. What did you want to ask?
How do you feel about the way things are going in this company?
How is your health?
Tell me your story again.
Then shortly after, I joined up with you.
Anything else?
Let's leave whenever you are ready.
Please do not waste any more of my time today. Perhaps we shall meet again.
Unfortunately, I can't take on any more hands in my party right now.

It seems that you are not esteemed enough by my people, {playername}. You are a {s29} and you need to be a {s24} for me to join [{reg3} more rank points needed].^Let's speak again when you are more accomplished.
I'm glad to see you have become {s29}, and I'm looking forward to joining you.
Well, there's little I can do then.
We meet again.
So... What have you been doing since our last encounter?
Yes?
Never mind.
I might be able to use you in my company.
Never mind, another time perhaps.
Good! Give me a few moments to prepare and I'll be ready to move.
My offer to rejoin you still stands, if you'll have me.

It is good to see you alive, {s5}! {s6}, and I did not know whether you had been captured, or slain, or got away. I've been waiting here since then, looking for news of your fate. Shall I get my gear together and rejoin your company?
It is good to see you, {s21}! To tell you the truth, I had hoped to run into you.
{s5}. Would you want me to rejoin your company?
Welcome back, my friend!
Sorry, I can't take on anyone else right now.
Well... Look me up if you change your mind, eh?
Thank you, I appreciate your support.
Hopefully it won't happen again.
Your objection is noted, but I have more important things on my mind.
I deem {s11} a valuable member of this company. You should appreciate {reg11?her:him} more.
You are right. I'm not happy with {s11}'s behavior myself and will let {reg11?her:him} know that.
I don't have time for petty squabbles.
I deem {s11} a valuable member of this company. You should appreciate {reg11?her:him} more.
You are right. I'm not happy with {s11}'s behavior myself and will let {reg11?her:him} know that.
I don't have time for petty squabbles.
Very good.
{s5}, {reg6?our:my} {s6} homeland is suffering grievously in the War, I ask you to consider helping {reg6?our:my} people as soon as we are rested and ready.
Then we shall ride to aid {s6} immediately.
I'm sorry, but we are needed elsewhere.
Tell me more.
We don't have time to chat just now.
I prefer my companions not to bother me with such trivialities.
{s33}^^I am in charge of the forces garrisoned here at {s21}. Did you want to see me?
Some of the soldiers in my group would be more useful here, to defend {s21}.
I want to review my soldiers stationed here.
I need some training.
I have brought you some prisoners.
{s33} Let's see the wretched scum.
Let me check our dungeon records...
Changed your mind, eh?
I'll make sure they won't escape from our dungeons.
Farewell.
Let me check the troop roster...
So you've changed your mind...^I see.
Let me check the troop roster...
So you've changed your mind...^I see.
We don't have use for those troops here...^Take them back.
Anything else?
What do you want?
Surrender! Your situation is hopeless!
Nothing. I'll leave you now.
Perhaps... Do you give your word of honour that we'll be treated well?
We are ready to leave this castle to you and march away if you give me your word of honour that you'll let us leave unmolested.
Surrender? Hah! We can hold these walls until we all die of old age.
I give you nothing. Surrender now or prepare to die!
Bastard. We will fight you to the last man!
You will be ransomed and your soldiers will live. I give you my word.
Very well then. Under those terms, I offer you my surrender.
You have my word. You will not come under attack if you leave the castle.
Very well. Then we leave this castle to you. You have won this day. But we'll meet again.
Unacceptable. I want prisoners.
Then we will defend this castle to the death, and this parley is done. Farewell.
You are my prisoner now.
I am at your mercy.
You have fought well. You are free to go.
{playername}!
Halt!
Is there no way to avoid this battle? I don't want to fight with you.
Don't attack! We surrender.
We will fight you to the end!
I owe you a favor, don't I. Well... all right then. I will let you go just this once.
Ha-ha. But I want to fight with you.
Away with you, vile beggar.
If it isn't my brave champion, {playername}...
Good to see you again {playername}...
We meet again, {playername}...
INVALID
Do I know you?
I am {playername}.
My name is {playername}. At your service.
I am {playername}.
They know me as {playername}. Mark it down, you shall be hearing of me a lot.
Well, {playername}...

Your surgeon managed to convince my friend and made the operation.  All we can do now is pray for his recovery. Anyway, I thank you for lending your surgeon to me, {playername}. You have a noble spirit. I will not forget it.
So, {playername}, you return from Fangorn. What did you find out?
The trees are alive! They assault our troops!
I suspected that all along. You have been of good service to me, {playername}.
My patience is over. I was expecting you to tell me something about Fangorn by now, but you know nothing.
Master, I hereby give you not one, but a pair of beasts!
Master, I subjugated the beast you have asked for!

Two beasts! Excellent, {playername}. You proved worthy, and skill and dedication must be rewarded. With your two trolls, We can now make without one of those We were using for Our experiments. It is a fully trained slave, ready to fight under command. We mean YOUR command, {playername}.
Can a savage beast be made to obey commands?
Thank you, Master. You will be pleased by the way this troll will be put in good use.
Thank you, master. But I'm not worth of your great gift. It is too dangerous for me.
Thank you, master. But I'm not worth of your great gift. [no room in party!]
Master, I will bring greater havoc if you also provide an armour for the beast [10/{reg20} influence].

Are you questioning the abilities of your Master, {playername}? This beast is trained to attack enemies on sight. This is enough. But, you and your warriors keep at due distance from the beast when it fights, and never stand between it and its victims.
Now bring havoc to my enemies with your new gift
As you wish, then. Someone else among of my servants will known how to use this mighty tool of war.

You dare ask for an fully armoured battle troll, {playername}, to keep under your command? That's not a small thing to ask for. But you are a skilled servant, and we know your motivations. We like that. It shall be granted.
How dare you ask Us for more than We have planned for you in our great Wisdom? {playername}, you proved a mighty Servant today, but don't let your insolence test Our patience any further.
Excellent, {playername}. You are a most faithful and useful servant. This troll will be most useful for our purposes. That it is taken to the dungeons!
Too long ago, I asked you to take me one troll alive. But I should have known. How could I expect someone like {playername} to be up to the challenge. My servant was not skilled or faithful enough.
News of your accomplishment against the wild trolls reached me. {s12} has one fear less to worry about, thanks to you, {playername}.
Our scouts near {s12} have told us about your success. This will teach them from spying on us.^^The destruction of this camp will surely halt our enemies' advance.
Our scouts near {s12} saw you and your men retreat. This is disappointing, {playername}. ^^Your failure resulted in the attack of vital supply lines. It will take some time to recover.
I will do better next time.

We have heard from our scouts near {s12} that you have valiantly defended the village. These raiders are becoming bolder every day... ^^We sense that war is surely coming. Thank you once more, {playername}.

We have heard from our scouts near {s12} that you have failed to defend the village. The villagers were either slaughtered or made into slaves. These raiders are becoming bolder every day... ^^We sense that war is surely coming.
I will do better next time.
We saw the flames coming from the village near {s12}. We heard the screams. This is only the beginning, {playername}. ^^War is coming.

We saw some of your men running away from the village near {s12}. You dare come back here and show your face, {playername}?. ^^There will be war, but with failures like this, you may be its first casualty.
I will do better next time.

Blast and damn you! I wanted TWO prisoners, {playername} -- what you've brought me is one step short of useless! I already know everything the spy knows, it was the handler I was after. Here, half a job gets you half a reward. Take it and begone.

I asked you for two prisoners, {playername}, not one. Two. Still, I suppose you did capture the spy's handler, the more important one of the pair. The spy will not dare return here and will prove quite useless to whatever master he served. 'Tis better than nothing. However, you'll understand if I pay you half the promised reward for what is but half a success.

Truly, {playername}, you are nothing short of totally incompetent. Failing to capture both the spy AND his handler plumbs astonishing new depths of failure. Forget any reward I offered you. You've done nothing to earn it.
I did my best, {s65}.
Thank you, {s65}.
Hrm. As you like, {s65}.
Damn me, but you've done it, {playername}. All the slaves are back and they're busy preparing for the harvest. You certainly earned your reward. Here, take it, with my compliments.
{playername}. I have been waiting patiently for my slaves, yet none have returned. Have you an explanation? Were you outwitted by simple animals, or are you merely incompetent?
Forgive me, {s65}, those slaves were slippery as eels.
Hmph, that is hardly an excuse for failure, {playername}. Now if you will excuse me, I need to capture new men to work these fields before we all starve.

You disappoint me, {playername}. There were 3 groups of slaves that I charged you to return. 3. Not {reg17}. I suppose the ones who did come back shall have to work twice as hard to make up for those that got away. As for your reward, {playername}, I'll only pay you for the slaves you returned, not the ones you let fly. Here. Take it, and let this business be done.
Thank you, {s65}. You are indeed generous.
Bah, this proved to be a waste of my time.
Ah, {playername}. I am pleased that you delivered {reg13} units of {s4}, as I requested. I'm impressed.
Not a problem, {s65}.
Glad to be of service.
You make a good scout, {playername}. My runner just brought me your reports of the mission to {s13}, {s14} and {s15}. Well done.
A simple task, {s65}.
Nothing I couldn't handle.
My pleasure, sir.

The army's supplies are dwindling too quickly, {playername}. I need you to bring me {reg3} units of {s4} so I can keep the troops fed. I care very little about where you get them, just bring them to me as soon as you can.
Very well, I can find you some {s4}.
Sorry, sir, I have other plans.
Excellent! You know what to do, {playername}, now get to it. I need that food sooner rather than later.
That . . . is unfortunate, {playername}. I shall have to find someone else who's up to the task. Please go now, I've work to do.
Ah, you have arrived at last, {playername}. We've been expecting you. I hope you have brought with you troops of sufficient number and experience.
I have a company of good, hardened soldiers with me. We are ready to join you.
I don't have the sufficient number of troops yet. I will need some more time.
Excellent. I will send the word when I have a task for you. For the moment, just follow us and stay close. We'll be moving soon.
Then you'd better hurry. We'll be moving out soon against the enemy and I need every able hand we can muster.

{playername}, I need a volunteer to scout the area. We're sorely lacking in information, and I simply must have a better picture of the situation before we can proceed. I want you to go to {s13}, {s14} and {s15} and report back whatever you find.
You've found your volunteer, sir.
I fear I must decline.
Good! Simply pass near {s13}, {s14} and {s15} and check out what's there. Make a note of anything you find and return to me as soon as possible.
Hm. I'm disappointed, {playername}. Very disappointed. We'll talk later, I need to go and find somebody to scout for us.

I heard that you have captured our enemy {s3} and he is with you at the moment. Good job!^ Leave him to us, there is a lot of information which we need to extract from him...^^[you will earn {reg14} Resource Points of {s14}]
Well, he is all yours.
I fear I have other plans for him.
Excellent! I'll send my men to take him to our prison with due haste. This will surely help our cause.
Too bad, he would have been precious for us, {playername}.

Ah, welcome, {s24}.^You should already know that {s12}. Your duty is to help in our struggle, {playername}. When you prove yourself worthy of my confidence [level {reg1}], I will also allow you access to that chest over there.
What is it?
Anything else?
I should like {s14} returned to me, {s65}, if you no longer require {reg3?her:his} services.
You've too many men in your company already, {playername}. You could not lead any more at the moment.
Certainly, {playername}. {reg3?She:He} is a bright {reg3?girl:fellow}, you're a lucky commander to have such worthy companions.
I bring a message from {s9}.
I bring a message from {s9}.
About the task you gave me...
Do you have any tasks for me?
My lord, I wish to enter into the lonely mountains, in search of King Bladorthin's lost spears.
I already gave you permission, {playername}.
Alright, {playername}, you may enter into the mountains.
I'm sorry, but I don't know or trust you well enough, {playername}.
I thank you, my Lord.
My lord, I found a sack with a fading emblem of grapes and some shards of wood and metal inside that could have belong to a spear.
Very interesting. This ancient sack could have born the mark of the finest wines that could only come from Dorwinion.
I also found this Rhun helm in the sack. Could this tell us more about what happened to the Spears?

Caravans are often robbed along the way. That helm is from a Rhun Scout. Follow the river down south to the Sea of Rhun and search the trade routes to Dorwinion and you may find what you are looking for. NOTE: THIS QUEST IS NOT YET COMPLETED. TO BE CONTINUED.
My lord, I am prepared to take more arduous tasks to serve you better and end this war. What would you have me do?

{playername}, I have heard of your exploits and you have made a name for yourself. I have a task specifically for such as yourself. You can deal with it however you wish.  Bloodshed cannot be avoided, especially against this group I am about to send you of to. Do you have sufficient men?
Yes, my lord. I have a group of well-trained, battlehardened men. We are ready for anything.
I am afraid not, my lord.
Then you are not ready for this task yet,{playername}. Go and gather more troops.

Excellent. The North has recently been plagued by a marauding band of outlaws, who raid villages and ambush travellers searching for rings of any kind   You are to hunt these bandits down and put an end to their quest. Survivors of their last pillaging have reported two groups.   One with their loot moving towards Mirkwood Forest. The other, a considerable size, towards Beorn's House, perhaps to continue their destructive search.
My lord, what could they be searching for?
My lord, I will do what is necessary to stop these... 'Ring Hunters'
I am not ready for such a task just yet.
You are brave, General. We will await news of your success
I see. Let me know when you are, but make haste, we do not want them to succeed.

It is hard to know exactly what they want with this, but we can see that they are going through great lengths to find what they are looking for.   All we can surmise is that this must be a powerful weapon of sorts, a weapon to be used to cause more destruction under the Dark Lord's name.

The Dark Lord previously sent emissaries to different dwarven clans, asking about the rings of power given to our people. These bandits may be looking for these..   Whether true or not, these must not fall into the Dark Lord's hands.
My lord, I come bearing ill news.. Though I have defeated the Ring Hunters terrorizing the villages, their leaders were not there. They may have found what they were looking for

This is not ill news,{playername}. We have heard of your great victory! The lives of those villagers matter more to our cause than any weapon. As we speak, the Beornings are amassing their strength, invigorated by your victory.     Moreover, we don't believe that these Ring Hunters found what they are looking for. If it was the weapon we feared, then we would have felt something.. a disturbance.
I am glad, then. Whatever this weapon may have been... they may still be looking for it. I will remain vigilant and remain on the lookout for more of these Ring Hunters.
We all will. Thank you once more for your service, {playername}.
My lord, though I was unable to intercept the Ring Hunters terrorizing the villages, I was able defeat their leaders in their lair. I also came across this
This is a minor ring of power.
Then we have prevented the Dark Lord from obtaining this, which he will undoubtly use to end more lives.
You must keep this ring and use against the Dark Lord's forces. We know you will use it well.
This is a tremendous honour, my Lord. Thank you. I shall continue the battle against the Dark lord, and this will help tremendously.
Look here, men. Another group to slaughter.
Your rampaging has come to an end.
Everyone, make sure you search their packs and their fingers. Save one to torture. Everything else you can eat.
That ring belongs to the Dark Lord! You can not have it!
This belongs to me now.
This defeat does not matter... our war party raged on! You are too late to save them!
General, we received a message from {s1} that a large bandit party was headed our way! We had no time to gather enough forces, and when we heard the sound of battle, we prepared for the worse!
That was no ordinary bandit party. They were a collection of the Dark Lord's best...however, their leaders were not here...They have a lair near Mirkwood Forest and I must make haste.

Yes, the message mentioned the lair and we sent scouts towards it. We saw them burn it down and leave towards Mordor...If you went there first, you may not have been able to help us. We are truly grateful for your victory
Then I must report back and tell {s1} what has transpired here. Go back to your village and prepare scouts. There may be stragglers.
Yes, General. We will remain vigilant. We will continue our efforts to recruit more men from surrounding villages. Your victory today has inspired us all.
Reinforce my party? I can always use a few more soldiers.
Unfortunately you don't have any {s14} soldiers to reinforce me with.
Let me check the soldier roster...
So you've changed your mind...^I see.
I don't have use for those troops here...^Take them back.
I want to request a special item.
Seems like you have no place in your inventory for anything else. Make some room, then return.
Really? Remember that you need to hold a certain rank and command considerable influence to deserve special items.^What can I give you?
{s24}: {s20} [costs {reg14}/{reg15} Influence]
Never mind then.
Very well. May you use it to vanquish our enemies.
I would like to have a council with you about the War.
I would hardly take advice if you are merely {s25}, {playername}. I would have been more inclined to listen if you were {s24}, but you are not.
You are an accomplished commander, {playername}, but your influence is waning. It would not be prudent to listen to your advice.^[{reg15} influence needed, only {reg14} held]
We can hardly afford to meet the enemy head on, {playername}. We still need to build up our forces and become strong, alas we are merely {s23}.
We are on a campaign, {playername}, your advice would have to wait.
I'm listening, {playername}. What do you suggest?
We should ride to besiege {s1} at once.
Never mind, I trust your judgement.
Very well, {playername}, I shall defer to your judgement. I shall send messengers to gather our forces.^Follow me and stay close - we ride to {s4}!
I bring a gift of {s1} from {s3} to the people of {s2}.
